alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 1:20PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Albany, northwestern Platte and south central Converse Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 119 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Curtis Gulch Campground, or 26 miles south of Douglas, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Friend Park Campground, Esterbrook, Curtis Gulch Campground, Windy Peak, Laramie Peak and Harris Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Occasional cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
